sen.j: 源 方子（みなもと の まさこ、治暦2年（1066年） - 仁平2年3月21日 (旧暦)（1152年4月27日））は、中納言藤原長実の妻。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Masako (1066-April 27, 1152) was the wife of Nagamitsu FUJIWARA, who had the title of Chunagon (middle counselor).
MINAMOTO no Masako (1066-April 27, 1152) was the wife of Nagamitsu FUJIWARA, who had the title of Chunagon (middle counselor).
MINAMOTO no Masako (1066-May 4, 1152) was the wife of Nagamitsu FUJIWARA, who had the title of Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
sen.cmt: April 27 をMay 4 に修正しました。middle counselor をvice-councilor of state に修正しました。

sen.e: She was a member of the Murakami-Genji (Minamoto Clan of Murakami).
She was a member of the Murakami-Genji (Minamoto Clan of Murakami).
She was a member of the Murakami-Genji (Minamoto clan).
sen.cmt: 用語集の表記を参考に (Minamoto Clan of Murakami) を(Minamoto clan) に修正しました。

sen.j: 父は堀河左大臣源俊房。
sen.e: Her father was MINAMOTO no Toshifusa, who had the title of Horikawa no Sadaijin (Minister of Left of Emperor Horikawa).
Her father was MINAMOTO no Toshifusa, who had the title of Horikawa no Sadaijin (Minister of Left of Emperor Horikawa).
Her father was MINAMOTO no Toshifusa, who had the title of Horikawa no Sadaijin (Minister of the Left of Emperor Horikawa).
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に従い、Minister of Left に the を追記しました。

sen.j: 美福門院藤原得子（鳥羽天皇皇后・近衛天皇生母）の母。
sen.e: She was a mother of FUJIWARA no Nariko, who had the title of Bifukumon-in (Empress to Emperor Toba and a birth mother of Emperor Konoe).
She was a mother of FUJIWARA no Nariko, who had the title of Bifukumon-in (Empress to Emperor Toba and birth mother of Emperor Konoe).
She was a mother of FUJIWARA no Nariko, who had the title of Bifukumon-in (Empress to Emperor Toba and birth mother of Emperor Konoe).

sen.j: 長承2年（1133年）8月19日に夫長実と死別した後、翌年出家して越後尼公と呼ばれた。
sen.e: After her husband Nagazane passed away on September 19, 1133, she underwent shukke (became a Buddhist priest) in the following year and was called as Echigoamako.
After her husband Nagazane passed away on September 19, 1133, she underwent shukke (became a Buddhist priest) in the following year and was called Echigoamako.
After her husband Nagazane passed away on September 29, 1133, she entered nunhood in the following year and was called Echigoamako.

sen.j: 久安2年（1146年）10月4日、正一位を贈られた。
sen.e: She received the rank of Shoichii (Senior First Rank) on November 9, 1146.

sen.j: 仁平2年（1152年）3月21日、87歳で没した。
sen.e: She passed away at the age of eighty-seven on April 27, 1152.
